types.name: Inpatient Rehabilitation
types.description: Residential treatment programs where patients live at the facility 24/7, receiving intensive care and support in a structured environment.

types.name: Outpatient Treatment
types.description: Flexible treatment programs that allow patients to live at home while attending scheduled therapy sessions and treatment appointments.

types.name: Detox Center
types.description: Medical facilities specializing in safely managing withdrawal symptoms as the first step in addiction recovery.

types.name: Residential Treatment
types.description: Long-term treatment facilities providing comprehensive care in a home-like environment for extended recovery periods.

types.name: Partial Hospitalization Program (PHP)
types.description: Intensive day programs offering hospital-level care during the day while patients return home in the evenings.

types.name: Intensive Outpatient Program (IOP)
types.description: Structured outpatient programs providing more intensive treatment than standard outpatient care, typically 3-5 days per week.

types.name: Sober Living Home
types.description: Transitional housing providing a drug and alcohol-free living environment for individuals in recovery.

types.name: Dual Diagnosis Treatment
types.description: Specialized treatment addressing both substance abuse and co-occurring mental health disorders simultaneously.

types.name: Luxury Rehabilitation
types.description: High-end treatment facilities offering premium amenities, private accommodations, and executive-level care.

types.name: Holistic Treatment
types.description: Treatment programs incorporating alternative therapies like yoga, meditation, acupuncture, and nutrition alongside traditional treatment.

types.name: Faith-Based Rehabilitation
types.description: Recovery programs incorporating spiritual practices and religious principles as part of the treatment approach.

types.name: Adolescent Treatment
types.description: Specialized treatment programs designed specifically for teenagers and young adults struggling with addiction.

types.name: Veterans Treatment Program
types.description: Treatment programs specifically designed for military veterans, addressing trauma, PTSD, and addiction unique to their experiences.

types.name: Medication-Assisted Treatment (MAT)
types.description: Treatment combining FDA-approved medications with counseling and behavioral therapies to treat substance use disorders.
